Attempt to sneak out of the room and explore the beach pad further
145222.content:
As your body trembles from the booming footsteps shaking the ground, you peer out from the behind the couch leg and look up to see the biggest woman you've ever seen before in your life.

The giantess is gorgeous. She has richly tanned skin and blonde hair and has a toned, athletic body. She's wearing a skimpy, navy blue bikini with a diamond navel piercing. She's barefoot, her toenails painted a bright white which match her fingernails.

She appears to have just come from tanning herself.

She doesn't look much older than her late teens or early twenties.

BOOM! BOOM! BOOM!

The booming becomes louder and the shaking more violent as the massive woman thunders across the room.

You watch her massive, tan feet slam down with each step the giantess takes. She's crossing the room extremely quick, the ground rumbling as you realize she's headed for the couch you're currently hiding beneath.

The massive tan peds come to rumbling stop before the couch and you fearfully stare at them. Each foot is large enough to crush numerous houses with a single step. The pedicured toes of her gigantic feet are currently facing the couch as well you shutter as you imagine being caught between the powerful digits.

The massive suddenly turn away from the couch and you hear what sounds like the sky is falling above you as you realize the giantess has just sat down on the huge couch. The couch creaks and groan slightly as the beautiful bikini clad giantess settles in.

Her feet are still resting flat on the ground with her heels in full view of you. You are frozen in fear beneath the couch, staring at her giant feet.

You hear the couch creak once more and then hear the enormous TV come to life. The couch creaks once more and then the huge feet disappear, a crashing sound making you realize she's just put her feet up on the table in front of the couch.

The TV booms loudly, a show completely foreign to you playing on it.

You begin to weigh your options as the giantess on the couch above you watches TV.
145222.title: A hot bikini-wearing giantess

choices: You live like a borrower in the house of a giant family
1453.content: There are a lot of possibilities here.
1453.title: Other choices

choices: The giant enters the kitchen. You're caught.
The giant doesn't enter the kitchen; you evade capture for now.
14531.content:
You'd been alone since you were 15. A three-inch tall human-like creature, once your parents had disappeared you were left completely alone. So to stay alive and in the vain hope you might encounter someone else of your species, you ran from house to house, never staying in one place for more than a month, eating what food you could forage and then leaving before the house's huge inhabitants had a chance to figure out they weren't the only tenants of the property.

You'd been doing this for 4 years. You'd run into nobody. You barely even spoke words anymore - who was there to talk to?

For the last two weeks, you'd been living in the house of a giant family of 5. You hated these; 10 pairs of colossal eyes that you had to dodge and be mindful of. You knew you wouldn't be there very much longer, you just needed to gather enough food for the next trek. There were two parents, both about 40. The patriarch of the family was called Mike, you thought, and his wife was Cassie. They had three kids; a twin brother and sister, both 18 and on the way to college in just a few short weeks, from what you'd heard. They were called Jenny and Dan. Lastly, there was their 14-year-old little brother, Todd.

All things considered they seemed a pretty nice, normal family. You'd been in some horrid, broken homes over the last couple of years and these guys seemed pretty at peace with the world. Which was something.

One day, when all of them were either at work, school, or otherwise engaged, you were in their kitchen, forraging for food...when you made the most basic of mistakes. You forgot to look right in front of you. You'd climbed their kitchen counter, hoping to find some food up there, when you failed to notice a large patch of syrup that had not been cleaned up. You walked right into it and cursed as you got stuck. You couldn't move your legs as the syrup stuck you fast to the desk. You pulled frantically, and you felt some give, but...oh no. The front door was opening! Someone was coming!

If they came into the kitchen, you were extremely visible.
14531.title: Life as a borrower

145311.content: So which family member catches you?
145311.title: The giant enters the kitchen. You're caught.

1453111.content:
The giant was either Mike, the 40-year-old Dad. Head of the household, brown hair (keeping the greys at bay) tall (around 6'2''), athletic build. Not really a jock but keeps himself in shape. Some chest hair.
Or it was Cassie, 39. Brunette, green eyes, generally kind but a stern mother/disciplinarian

So which of the parents catches you?
1453111.title: One of the parents

choices: I'll let you run around naked
14531111.content:
"What have we here?" Mike effortlessly peels you from the sticky desk, and holds in front of his face, "Who are you, little guy? Hmm I guess Cassie is babysitting one of the neighbor's kids. Wow, you are filthy. Don't worry, Uncle Mikey will clean you up."

To your horror, Mike carries you over to the kitchen sink and begins filling it with warm soapy water.

Uh-oh, he's gonna give me a bath!

The giant man tugs off your t-shirt. YOu turn onto your stomach and desperatley try to scurry away, but he just yanks down the waistband of your jeans, leaving you just your plaid boxers.

"You're a squirmy little fella," Mike chuckles pinning you down so he can rip off your underwear, leaving you completely naked in front of this powerful giant man. He picks up your naked body and plops it in the sink, scrubbing you all over, even you privates. He then proceeds to soap his finger.

"One last place to get nice and clean"

"Noooo!" He jams his giant index finger into your butthole and cleans it thouroughly. "Much better. Well these clothes need to be washed. For now-
14531111.title: Mike

choices: She gets the kids or her husband to help torture you
14531112.content:
You see a huge brunette approaching you. She has tanned skin and looks good. You figure this must be the mother. She spots you on the counter stuck in the syrup and pokes you in the chest hard. You cry out as she says, "what's a matter bug? Get yourself into a sticky situation?" She giggled before pulling you out of the syrup. "Whats a tiny person doing in my house anyway?" She said as she lifted you up to her large green eye. "Can you not talk?" She said as she shook you.

"Thank you for pulling me off of the counter, I was really stuck and I-" "I don't care." The giantess said flatly. "I hate insects in my house. So it's time for you to leave." She walked into the living room and placed you on the floor. You noticed she was barefoot and you looked at the red toenails on her massive foot. "I'll give you a chance to run but don't expect to get away." You turned and began to run away from her. "Hmmm there's a bug in my floor. Looks like it's squish time!" You heard the ground booms and the ground shook as she walked towards you.

A large tanned foot landed in front of you blocking your path. She played with you blocking off your path with her large feet as she taunted and insulted you. Eventually she grew bored of this and decided what to do.
14531112.title: Cassie

choices: "Get the kids to help me torture you"
"Keep you as a toy for my husband and I to torture"
145311121.content: "My kids would get a kick out of having a tiny person as a toy." She mused. "But I'm sure my husband and I would have a lot of fun with a tiny person too." You struggled in her fist but it was useless. You were either going to end up as a child's play thing or a giant couples toy. You shuddered as you thought of all the stuff that could happen to you in either situation. Finally Cassie spoke, "I think I'm going to...."
145311121.title: She gets the kids or her husband to help tortur...

choices: Refuse to be a slave-get stomped
Agree to be the family slave
145311122.content: "You need to be punished for sneaking into my house." She squeezed you tightly in her fist as she grabbed you. "I would love to stomp you out of existence. I'm sure my family would love to help me end you too. Or do you want to be my family's slave bug?" You knew there was no way out. If you declined she would stomp on you but if you said yes you would be tortured by several giants. You had to choose. "I'm feeling kind today so I'll give you a choice. What'll it be bug? Stomped by me or be my family's slave?"
145311122.title: A choice

1453112.content:
One of the family's three kids find you.

Which one is it?

The first twin is Jenny. Brunette (like her mother), but taller than her. Quite upbeat, likes anime, headed to college in a couple of weeks. Very smart, straight-A student.
Her twin is Dan, who is slightly taller, also Brunette. Not as tall or muscular as his dad but lean and wiry; a runner more than a heavy lifter. Swims from time to time. Like his sister, headed to college soon, but a different one.

Or it could be their little brother Todd. A bit of a chip on his shoulder after being the youngest of three, but generally a polite and well-meaning kid. Brown hair, some freckles, a couple of zits.
1453112.title: One of the three kids

choices: ...smirked. He wanted you to be afraid. Pets SHOULD be afraid.
...shook his head. He reassured you he would never hurt you.
145311212.content:
Your panic intensified as you realised the gigantic male twin, the one you thought was called Dan, came in. He wore shorts and a blue t-shirt, twirling his keys in his finger, whistling a tune and generally looking quite relaxed.

The guy had no idea you were there. He hadn't looked over yet. For a second, you had hope, and that hope was redoubled as you felt your leg move a little in the syrup - you might get out of this yet!

But no. Dan looked over, you heard a slight gasp and he raised his eyebrows and you knew you were screwed. He walked over slowly, as if you would run off, and crouched down. You whimpered in terror as he crouched down and watched you for a moment.

"What the hell..." he asked, as he examined you. This was an opportunity, you supposed...he hadn't grabbed you yet. If you were able to get free, you might still be to run away, climb into a nearby hole in the wall, under the sink, something like that.

But hope was a fool's game. As you continued to struggle, Dan figured out what was happening.
"Oh, are you stuck, little guy? Here, let me help you..."

You yelled out in terror as enormous fingers, about as big as you, gently wrapped around you and pulled you up with unbelievable strength. Effortlessly, the giant picked you up and freed you from the clutches of the syrup, but you weren't exactly pleased about it. In fact, the ease with which he had picked you up just compounded your terror. With you secured in his hand, Dan pulled up a chair and sat down in it, then stared right into your eyes. He could see your fear and...
145311212.title: Dan's pre-college summer got WAY more interesting!

1453112122.content:
Seeing the fear etched not just on your face but your entire body - you were shaking like a leaf - Dan started to say "don't be scared," in a calming voice. But before he could, you got a grip and shouted:

"Just get it over with, you big freak!"

Dan raised his eyebrows. "Whoa. You talk? You're not just some weird type of bug?"
"Of course I can talk!" you exclaimed. "Now get it over with!"

If you were going to die, you were going to do it with bravery and honour, not begging for your life.

But Dan just raised his eyebrows curiously. "Get what over with?"

"Squishing me! Eating me! Whatever it is you freaks do!"

Dan regarded you with a look of disgust. "Why would I do that?" he asked genuinely. "How dumb would that be? 'Oh look I found this amazing little creature who walks and talks and is just as smart as me, so instead of trying to communicate with him, I'll just kill him straight away'."

You looked down and didn't reply.

He took your silence as an acceptance, so he put you down on the kitchen table, next to the syrup you'd been found in.

"What's your name? I'm Dan."
"I know," you said.
There was a pause, then Dan leaned forward and whispered, "this is the part where you tell me your name."
You supposed it couldn't do any harm. "Kyrie."
"Nice name," Dan replied, his eyes not leaving you.

There was more silence.

"So...so...what are you gonna do?" you asked, trying to lead the conversation and maintain your stoic persona.
"Well, not squish or eat you, that's for sure. I just...I don't know. This is crazy. Did you shrink or were you always like this?"
What an odd question. "Um...I was always like this. Why would I have shrunk? That's ridiculous."
Dan laughed loudly. "Because this isn't ridiculous at all."

You supposed he had a point.

Dan kept just staring at you in wonder. You shifted uncomfortably, his gigantic gaze penetrating you. You felt incredibly tiny underneath it, and looked around for an escape route. Something to run behind. But there was nothing - or at least nothing within a distance you could reach before those monstrous hands grabbed you again. So you just stayed still and prayed silently.

"How'd you wind up in the syrup?" he asked after a little while.
You explained.

"...So you were stealing our food? Scrounging around our kitchen like a little rat?"
Shamefully, you stared at your feet. "Um...yes. I'm sorry."

Dan didn't say anything and you cringed.

After a while, he spoke up. "Well, I guess it makes sense. And it's not like we noticed anything was missing."

There was more silence, then Dan said, "this is just so crazy. I can't believe tiny people exist. And it's just you? Where are your parents?" He winced as soon as he asked the question, as if he knew the answer.
"They disappeared...about four years ago," you said, a little amazed it had been that long. "This is the first conversation I've had since then."

Dan shook his head. "I'm sorry, Kyrie. Nobody deserves that."
You shrugged. "You just get used to it."

He was frowning, examining you. "You're about my age, aren't you?"
"I dunno. How old are you?"
"18."
"19."
"Cool. Well look, little man, here's a crazy idea. Why don't you come live with me? You could use the company, and I'm not going to lie, it'd be freaking awesome to have a little 3-inch roommate."

You considered. "Wait...roommate? Not pet? Not toy?"

He just laughed again. "No. I mean what I said. I''m headed to college in a couple of months, I've got my own room there. No reason you can't come with."
"A...and you won't keep me in a cage?"
"No."
"Or eat me?"
"For the tenth time, no."

You considered it. It was quite the offer. A very, very good offer. An offer almost too good to be true...

So how do you respond?
1453112122.title: "Relax, little man."

choices: Yes. Dan tells the family about you.
No. You're Dan's little secret for now.
14531121221.content:
If he really was just going to let you be, you figured you could always find a way to escape. You trusted your wits and that you were smarter than some giant.

"OK," you said. "OK."

Nodding your head slowly, Dan broke into a broad smile. "Cool! This is gonna be great!"

He reached out and grabbed you and you winced. "Don't worry, I gotcha. You'll be fine," he said in a whisper so as not to alarm you. "Here."

Now he was opening the hand and you gave a yelp in terror until you realised his other hand was right below you and you fell into the palm. You looked around, still scared out of your skin, trying to situate yourself comfortably in the hand.

"Can't believe I'm gonna have a 3 inch dude living in my room!" he exclaimed.
Can't believe I'm going to be living with a giant freak, you thought.

Suddenly, there was commotion outside. The rest of the family were coming. Does Dan reveal you?
14531121221.title: "Um...OK, sure!"

choices: Time skip a couple of months - Dan is moving into his room at college.
145311212212.content:
"Hmm...don't want them finding out...the parents might take you," he said.

Still a little alarmed, Dan brushes you into his hand, then drops you in his hoodie pocket. It's loose and airy in there, meaning you bonce around a lot. Dan, for his part, understood this and quickly reached in and grabbed you with care, holding you in place. You heard him say a brief hello to his family before bounding upstairs with you..

When you next came out of the pocket, you were in Dan's room, with only your head sticking out of the hand which wrapped around you - though incredibly gently.. "Well it's not much," he boomed, and you looked around. It was more than big enough for you, though there was a lot of mess - videogames, books, etc - on the floor. You didn't want to add to it.

You looked around in awe at the bed, the desk, the wardrobe..."I've never been in a giant's room before," you gasped out loud.
"Well, now it's your room too," Dan said with a smirk. "Mi casa, su casa, and all that stuff."

He sat down on the bed, you still in hand, and looked at you in wonder. "This is still so crazy," he said, shaking his head in disbelief.
You were disbelieving too - that a giant would offer to share their room with you and be so...well, nice. "For me too," you said.

Dan smirked. "I bet it is."

What happens now?
145311212212.title: No. You're Dan's little secret for now.

choices: There was that time I had a run-in with a pet down the street...
1453112122121.content:
A couple of hours later, Dan had set up a bed for you under his own. He'd offered a place on his bedside table or on his desk but you'd said you preferred to stay somewhere less visible. Besides, you wouldn't have to climb around so much if you were on the floor. "Just watch out for my feet," Dan said, only half-joking. "I can't be held responsible for what happens before I have a cup of Joe."
"A cup of what?"
"Oh, um-coffee. So will that bed be ok?"

You glanced over at the bed. It was a combination of clean socks ("I only got this pair last week," Dan said), a cloth and even a neatly-folded silk tie Dan hadn't worn since his grandmother's funeral.
"It's great," you said enthusiastically. "I usually sleep in...well, whatever I can find."

Dan chuckled and at this picked you up off the ground. You winced at the speed with which he did it and tried not to yell out - before you knew it the ordeal was over and you were standing on Dan's enormous chest. You looked around, before seeing his huge eyes staring right at you.

"Tell me a story," said the giant.
"How do you mean?"
"Well, you run around in the walls. You must have a bunch of amazing stories to tell," he said earnestly.
"Well..."
1453112122121.title: Settling in.

choices: "Maybe I'll keep living in the walls and come out to see you from time to time."
"I'll be fine. Just give me some time to get used to it."
14531121221212.content:
"Um..not really. We try and keep as hidden as possible...I mean, I guess if I'd escaped you today I'd have a story to tell."
"But you're like 2 inches tall! You must have had so many crazy adventures."
"I th-think it's less exciting than it looks. It's a lot of hiding and scrounging and waiting."

Dan screwed up his face into a grimace. "Sounds boring," he said.
"Yeah."

He shrugged. "Oh well, now you can live a more exciting life." With that, he reached out and grabbed you once again. You yelped out in surprise and he put you back down on his chest straight away.
"What?" he asked.
"It's just...your hand. It's..." you started to hyperventilate.

Fortunately, Dan noticed and withdrew the hand. "Hey...hey. Relax. Relax," he said, but his soothing voice wasn't doing anything. "Are you literally having a panic attack?" he asked.
"Don't-know-what-that-is," you gasped. Dan looked around, panicked, then slid you gently off his chest and onto the duvet cover, before kneeling next to the bed and watching you.
"Calm down..." he whispered gently. "Calm down. Deep breaths."

His soothing voice had the desired effect, even if it boomed terrifyingly around you. You began to breathe slowly and more fully, and before long the feelings of abject terror began to leave you. You looked up into Dan's huge eyes and saw he still looked worried, though a little less so.

"Listen," he said, once he was sure you were back to normal. "Maybe this isn't the best idea...you living with me. I mean...like...it's so awesome having you around, little guy. But I don't want you to have a heart attack every time I come near you."

You shivered and thought about it.
14531121221212.title: No Stories

145311212212122.content:
You were still breathing heavily, but getting better and better.

"I'll be fine. Honestly. Don't worry about me."
"Well I-"
"Just...give me some warning when you're going to p-pick me up, OK?"

He chuckled and grinned hugely. "Sure."

"I'm gonna go get something to eat. You chill out here, get to know the place, and I'll be back soon with some food. You sure you're OK?"

"Yeah, I'll-I'll be ok." You sat on the bed as Dan drew himself to his full and magnificent height before walking slowly out of the room. You wondered around on the bed, going all the way to the edge before shrugging and beginning to slowly climb your way down it. Soon, you found yourself on the floor. You gazed up at the monasterial, insanely huge room and felt smaller than ever. This was where the giant slept. It was his domain. You were an intruder in it, really. You wondered around, taking in the various decorations - a couple of posters on the wall, a videogame console, etc.

Soon enough you heard somebody coming...your instincts took over and you ran under the bed as the door opened. Did the person see you?
145311212212122.title: "Just give me some time to get used to it."

1453112122121221.content: You were seen, but who by?
1453112122121221.title: Yes.

14531121221212211.content:
As you ran under the door, Dan saw you and laughed. "I see you there, little man," he said with a slight undertone of arrogance. "Good job that wasn't someone else..." he added.

Cautiously, you stepped out from underneath the bed. Dan was carrying a napkin, presumably full of food, in one hand. This was the first time you'd been at foot-height and actually able to stare all the way up at him from below. He truly was a terrific sight to behold...you'd lived around giants all your life but to have one staring down at you, so close, made you want to kneel and worship in the hope that would be enough to placate. Fortunately, Dan knelt down quickly, making himself less intimidating, and reached out, palm up, for you to climb onto. You did so without a word and held on as he lifted it carefully through the air, placing you, and the napkin full of food, on the bed. You looked at it and saw just how much was there and turned to Dan quizzically.

"Um, Mr. Dan, sir, how much of that is for me?"
Dan laughed. "All of it, dummy! And please don't ever call me "Mr. Dan, sir" again."
Your eyes lit up and you tore into the food. Dan watched, amused.
"Guess you were pretty hungry, huh?"
You said something that nobody could possibly understand, so full was your mouth of food. Dan's laughter redoubled. "Slow down. You'll get a bad stomach."

Ignoring this, you finished up.

"Wow," said Dan. "That...was something."
You were satisfied. That was the most food you'd had...ever. "Thank you," you said.
"Way more where that came from," replied the giant.


Dan reached out again and you gratefully hopped into his palm. He raised you to his face and you stared into his huge, brown eyes. You felt stronger for eating the food, but you doubted you'd ever be prepared for the giant's gaze upon you.

You sat down in the palm and waited for what Dan's next move would be. You realised that even with Dan being so nice, you'd sacrificed a little bit of your freedom for security. But it was an acceptable trade.

"I'm heading out on my bike, little man. You want to come with me? It might be fun."
14531121221212211.title: Dan was back

choices: After a while, you fell out, without Dan immediately noticing!
You continued to Dan's destination - a diner.
145311212212122111.content:
"Wow, really?" Dan answered. "I...didn't think you'd want to. Cool!"
Dan placed you on the bed and went over to his chair - there was a hoodie hanging off the back of it which he quickly pulled on.

"Hey, I'm going to put you in my hair and my hoodie on. That way you'll be secure, and you'll be able to see everything."
This didn't sound very 'secure' to you, but you tried to hide your fear. You didn't want to be awkward - you were still scared that Dan could turn nasty at any moment. "Sure," you said, and when he walked over and held out his palm, you climbed in straight away. He raised it up, higher and higher, and you made sure not to look down as the air whooshed by you. You winced as you felt the hand start to tip, and you slid off it, landing safely in his dark hair.

Fortunately, it was very clean and smelt good. He looked after it, clearly. You grabbed some of the hairs in as strong a grip as you could - though you had to admit, being dwarfed by the hair of this giant made you feel smaller than ever - and lay down flat. "OK up there?" said Dan's voice, floating up towards you. You felt the vibration of his speech coursing through his head and you were a little awed by it.
"Yeah," you called down quickly.
"Cool. You feel so weird up there," he chuckled, before putting the hood up.

You felt much warmer and more secure with the hood on top of you. It covered you like a blanket, but you could still see out of the front. Dan walked, slowly at first, but when you called down that it was OK, he began to move a little more quickly. Soon, he had reached the garage, where his bike was, and got on. "Alright, here goes..." you mumbled to yourself, tightening your grip on the hair.

Dan set off at a gentle pace. "You OK?" he murmured, seeming not to move his lips much.
"Yep," you lied.

Dan picked up the pace.
145311212212122111.title: "Um, OK."

choices: Just as it looked like things were going well...you fall out of the hood.
1453112122121221112.content:
After an exhilirating and - honestly - quite enjoyable journey, you reached the place Dan had wanted to go: a diner. You recognised it from those occasions you'd snuck a peek at the family's TV.

As Dan slowed the pace you took a moment to collect yourself. The insanity of what had happened today coupled with the adrenaline rush of that ride had been insane and you found yourself out of breath. "This is the place," he mumbled quietly. "Looks pretty quiet, I'll be able to take you out without anybody seeing."

It seemed as though you wouldn't have any choice in the matter, though being seen by more giants was the last thing on your agenda for today. But you would just have to trust that Dan would be careful.

He carefully walked inside and went and sat at a booth; the noise of the diner was almost overwhelming, but your proximity to Dan muffled the sound. You hunkered in, closer to his head.

You closed your eyes and tried to remain calm as Dan ordered coffee and a sandwich, before you felt the head move back and forth. A second later, the hand was on you again, this time gently removing you. Before you could figure out what was happening, you were staring up at Dan, the ground beneath you loose and smooth.

After a second, you got your bearings. You were on the seat, between Dan and the window, next to Dan's thigh. Nobody would be able to see you from here, even the waitress when she came with coffee. It was pretty smart.

"You OK?" he said, almost without moving his lips at all. You simply nodded in response. "Wish I could put you on the table or something," he added, a little more clearly.

You shook your head wildly. "I know, I know," he chuckled. "Don't worry, I won't let anyone else find out about you. Then I'd have to share my toy," he said with a wink and a grin. You didn't really find it very funny.

It wasn't the most pleasant half-hour but eventually you grew to enjoy it. Dan fed you a little bit of his sandwich and some coffee, then paid. Every now and then he said something and you did your best to reply to him, trying to find a volume that he could hear but that nobody else could. It was difficult.

"It'll be fun taking you to more places," Dan mumbled after he'd put down some cash. "There's so much you probably haven't seen."
You shuddered at the idea.

"Don't worry, Kyrie," he said again. "I'll keep you safe."

He shot you a reassuring smile and in that split second, you decided that you believed in Dan. Maybe you were gullible, maybe it was a lack of interaction with other people, but you instinctively believed what he was saying. You nodded up at him in a way you hoped appeared decisive, and he seemed to get the message because his smile widened.

Nonetheless, you winced as he reached down; he picked you up more lightly than more, and slightly ruffled your hair before placing you in his hood, which he put up with his other hand. "Alright, now the trip home. Hold on tight, little guy," he instructed, before standing up.

The rush of vertigo was incredible, but it was less terrifying now - more exhilirating. You took a deep breath and smiled. Maybe this would be fun after all.
1453112122121221112.title: You continued to Dan's destination - a diner.

choices: Something happens while Dan is away...(your choice)
145311212212122112.content:
Dan shrugged. "Sure, man. Just stay out of sight, don't want someone else finding you."
You grinned. "I did a good job of that until that stupid syrup got in the way."


"Hah, yeah, I suppose it would be weird if you went your entire life without being found and then got found twice in one day. But still, be careful. I'll be back in an hour."
145311212212122112.title: "...Can I stay here?"

choices: Dan gently plays with you a little before bed.
1453112122121221121.content:
Dan returned an hour later, and even though you heard colossal movements and voices around the house, nobody came into the room while he was gone.

You hid when the door opened, but it was just your captor, your new friend, or whatever he was supposed to be. He whispered, "Kyrie? You around?"

Leaving your hiding place under the bed you stepped out and stared up at the giant. "Hi. I'm OK. I-" your breath stopped short as the air pressure all around you changed. Dan was crouching down.
"Hi there," he said with a grin. Your words caught in your throat as Dan's face lowered slowly towards you, but you stammered out a greeting.

You woke with a start, but didn't immediately open your eyes. You still weren't quite sure if it was a weird dream (or a nightmare). You supposed there was only one way to find out...

You opened them up. You were under the giant's bed. You could see the depression of the mattress above, and hear his breathing - breathing that sounded like wind through the trees to you. Your heart raced. If ever there was a time to escape, it was now!

Slowly, surely, you got up out of your makeshift bed and crept out from underneath the giant's. You began to walk to the door - once you reached the landing you'd be able to get to one of your little holes and then you'd be safe.

But then you stopped, your instinct to escape the giant's room overcome by what had actually happened. You had chosen to stay. You had agreed to stay with the giant, Dan, until he did you wrong, and he hadn't yet - he'd shown you unbelievable kindness, in fact. But then...what if that changed? What if you didn't make the choice to leave until it was too late?

You sighed, weighing up your options, when you heard Dan's booming voice and you winced.

"Going somewhere?"
You turned. The giant had sat up in bed, and there was a look of mild amusement on his face, which was a relief.
"No," you said innocently. "Just...looking around."

"Ah. OK." You got the impression he didn't believe you. How long had he been watching? Had he seen you stop suddenly? He wasn't giving anything away.

He laughed, a deep, hearty laugh that caused you to fall over on his chest. This made him laugh even more. "Please call me Paul," he said when he'd calmed down.

His eyes lit up. "Good, little man!" he reached out with a finger and ruffled your hair excitedly. "That'd be great!" Paul grinned, his beard rustling.

The giant just stared at you for a second, the broad grin on his face. He continued ruffling your hair, compressing your head into your neck. You smiled back, doing as best you could not to yell out in pain, and reached up to pat the enormous, leathery finger.
